Reviews.Title: “What an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: tripper41_11
Reviews.Content: On a city break to Rome and stayed here,literally 2 minutes from the Trevi Fountain and within walking distance of the Vatican,Spanish Steps and Colloseum.Lovely narrow streets,ancient buildings and restaurants galore.Hotel quite basic but location more than compensates.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Norman78
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior room. Had actually two bed-rooms. Not certain what standard rooms were like but we were pleasantly surprised with what we got. Considering the cost of rooms in Rome we feel we got good value. The hotel is located about 50 metres from the Trevi fountain which was fantastic as one could visit at the quiet times such as 2 am! Because of the location we were able to walk everywhere for the five days. The Vatican was a bit away but there were many places on the way which one would want to visit anyway so this was not a problem. We only had breakfast at the hotel and could be best described as so-so.

Reviews.Title: “great location, poor hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Eyal C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights' in the 4th floor room 418, I have to say that there are 2 different wings for this hotel, if you order via internet they will put you on the poor wing (which we stay in), the room is 3 meter on 3 meter very very small comparing to every hotel I have been ever…it's smallest room. The bathroom is very old and poor and the room is very basic The breakfast is the same every day, nothing ordinary and the beds are small and not comfort at all The only good thing in this hotel is the great location; I think maybe the best in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Anatea
Reviews.Content: More like 2 star hotel than 3. Standard rooms very small, furnished poorly, old style tv mounted on the wall like a cheap motel. Had to complain in order to change a room but if you order a standard room and they have no other rooms to change you are stuck there for your vacation. very expensive for what it offers. Cold unfriendly reception staff, cordial but not nice. Breakfast ok. Plenty of nicer places in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Even the great location doesn't make up for the bad service”
Reviews.Author: BenBariach
Reviews.Content: My company booked this hotel for business; The staff are frowny and unhelpful. The rooms were small, claustrophobic and quite unclean. My colleagues got uncomfortable beds and the navigation through the hotel corridors is complicated. The locationis fantastic - right outside of Trevi Fountain, but even that doesn't make up for the rest. It wasn't an awful experience - But from a cost-effective POV, I would book a different hotel anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Gil71
Reviews.Content: Hi My wife an I took some time off together for Rome. We found that This hotel is located at a great place, on minute from trevi fountain , but quiet enough at night. It is clean and descent. Rooms are small but cosy. Breakfast is Basic and more than sufficient. price was reasonable. Great.

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: Paulina W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my fiancé. I got a room in the 4th floor and I remember when I stepped on the floor, it was kinda move, like the foundation is not that strong. But everything else was OK, means standard. If you are spending most of the day going around the city, and be in the hotel just to sleep, take shower, store your luggages, and served your belly some breakfast, then this hotel is perfect. Trevi Fountain is just steps away and you can walk to most of the tourist attractions Rome has to offer. But do not choose this hotel if you want a little extra something something apart from those activities :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Grover2008
Reviews.Content: Hotel Accademia is in an excellent location - it really is 50m from the Tevi Fountain. It's also about a 5 minute walk to the Pantheon. It's easy to walk to everything from the hotel. The room was basic, clean and comfortable. The bathroom could have been a little better - the shower over the bath was a bit small. Had a great selection for breakfast. Rooms were quiet considering the location. Staff were helpful. Internet was 3 euros per hour. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sandra h
Reviews.Content: What a great location just around corner from the Trevi Fountain & within walking distance of other attractions & metro. The hotel was very good with pleasant staff, the rooms were good cleaned every day with clean towels. Plenty of choice hot & cold for breakfast. Would stay here again & would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: traveller1717
Reviews.Content: Great location just around the corner from Trevi Fountain. We walked everywhere! The breakfast was fabulous with scrambled eggs, meats, and cheeses in addition to wonderful pastries. They made decaf cappuccino for me each morning. Everyone on the staff was most helpful; in fact they adjusted our booking to place us next to friends. Room was spacious for a European hotel and bathroom adequate. Air-conditioning worked even though it was late September.

Reviews.Title: “you cannot fault the location”
Reviews.Author: JohnMac1947
Reviews.Content: We have slightly mixed feeling about this hotel after our 4 days in September 2011. The positives are many, especially for an italian 3 star hotel. Our room (312) was clean and comfortable even if we did have two single beds rather than the double we were expecting. Room facilities such as safe, working aircon, opening windows were all OK. In common with a few hotels on our trip I was however forced to unplug the TV to get a powerpoint for my phone / iPad chargers and the wifes hair wand. Don't like the policy of wifi charges but this wasn't the only place where they seek to charge on a per day basis. (actually my iPad is 3g enabled and within 10 minutes at the nearest TIM store I had a prepaid mini-sim installed and working so lack of wifi wasn't a deal breaker. Breakfast was very good although often very crowded, maybe we just picked the wrong times. Location is wonderful, Trevi literally 126 metres in a straight line. walking distance to Vatican, Spanish Steps, Via del Corso (the best shopping street in rome my wife says), hop on - hop off bus stop very close and of course lots of local restaurants to make up for the lack of an inhouse restaurant at the hotel. Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Piazza Venezia and even the Colosseo were within walking distance for us (both of us are in our 60's) Front desk staff, particularly the males, were very offhand, almost dismissive which detracted from the experience of our first time in Rome. loved the location but not at all sure i would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A quite average hotel at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: takataka99
Reviews.Content: After we were rudely (my wife was pregnant and they did not even bother to inform us earlier or call for a cab to take us to another hotel) sent here by a sister hotel, Elite Hotel, few comments on Accademia: Perfect location but quite average accomodation (room, breakfast, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and yet close to everything”
Reviews.Author: GuyMrefu
Reviews.Content: The Trevi fountain is at a stonethrow's distance, and the Pantheon, Spanish steps, old Jewish ghetto, etc are all just a short walk away. Inside it is nice and quiet. Rooms are relatively small and dark, but who wants to stay inside their room when in Rome anyway? Wireless internet was working well but expensive (which is actually true for the hotel as a whole). We were there for business/conference, but virtually all other guests were tourists. This is the kind of place I would reserve if I were travelling with my (elderly) parents, preferring a more rustic/less expensive place myself. The hotel's best feature was the breakfast: very fresh and a huge variety of foods!

Reviews.Title: “Love the accomodation and service”
Reviews.Author: ernie r
Reviews.Content: Excellent location.Couple of minutes to trevi,Pantheon,Plaza Spagna.Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Room very clean. Breakfast excellent. Recommned it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient hotel lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieJJ58
Reviews.Content: Hotel Accademia has to be the most convenient hotel in any city I have ever stayed in lifetime! The hotel was clean, the staff lovely, my bed was so comfortable and quiet, with only the sound of distant church bells, I had trouble getting out of bed in the morning. The air con worked well for summer in Rome and the room was large by European standards for a 3-star hotel and had a safe and many other amenities. Basically I just loved it and felt it was more than 3-star!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: bjcgl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Accademia in Rome was just around the corner from the Trevi Fountain - great location - we walked everywhere! The rooms were small, but clean and modern. Breakfast, bus tour of city, and transportation from airport to hotel were included. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved this Hotel - Close to everything but quiet too.”
Reviews.Author: athenry22
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel, it had everything we required, great position in a small street, just around the corner from the Trevi Fountain, quiet spot but so close to all the busy little streets nearby, the accommodation was good, the rooms were bigger and cleaner than I had expected, reception staff very helpful, breakfast was included and there was a lot of choice, (teenagers loved it) the restaurant a couple of doors away had amazing pasta and Pizza's as you would expect. We went out late at night to the Trevi fountain, so many people about enjoying themselves, someone was even getting married at midnight, the vibe of this city is wonderful, we were able to walk to so many places and see so much more on foot than in a tour bus, all the way to the Vatican in fact. We would definately recommend this hotel and since we threw money into the Trevi fountain so ensure we get back there and when we do we will be staying here thats for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DubaiCamel2176
Reviews.Content: Ideally located near the Trevi Fountain, restaurants and a short walk to great shopping in the heart of Rome. Our room was huge....a king size bed with plenty of room for a few more! Being such a great location, our room was a little noisy with so much outside activity, however this wasn't bad enough to cause discomfort. Staff were friendly, happy to arrange tours and transport and on each occasion, followed through to make sure our pick-ups were correct and arrived on time. Nice hot buffet breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the pizzeria next door”
Reviews.Author: fbernaerts
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. It is clean and very well located but have you ever wondered why they do not show the picture of a bathroom for the standard rooms on their website? Avoid the Pizzeria next door: the owner is very unfriendly, laughing behind your back and bullying his staff. His only objective is to get you out of there as soon as possible (after you have eaten your frozen pizza).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Good hotel choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: breezey103
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this hotel, travelling as part of a work group, so it was chosen for us. The location is fantastic! Just steps away from the Trevi Fountain, and close to restaurants. Rome is a very easy city to walk around in, and we did this for most of our time there. The hotel itself is nothing overly fancy but is very clean and comfortable. Like most European hotels, the rooms are quite small and the lifts are even smaller (I say take the stairs wherever possible!) The bathroom was also very small, but modern and nice. I have no hesitations in recommending this hotel to my clients and other travellers heading to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “great location to reach all the main attractions in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Maria-Maltija
Reviews.Content: The location is very central so you can reach all the main attractions in Rome on foot. It was second time that stayed in this hotel but this time chose a suite with parquet flooring and it was so much better. The room was bug free and more comfortable and clean. It was worth paying a bit more. As regards breakfast it was good and they even catered for celiacs.

Reviews.Title: “it was great”
Reviews.Author: lora111
Reviews.Content: i stayed with my son the room was nice clean Quiet the location is realy very good the staff was warm and helpful i enjoyd it very much i would like to come back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Terrible rooms & poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Katerina8113
Reviews.Content: Very expensive hotel, 200euros/night, with terrible rooms and plastic food as breakfast, very good location - 2 minutes from fountain di Trevi -. No value for money at all !!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,good basic service and som faults”
Reviews.Author: 189852Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights over the New Year in the hotel spending my days mostly away in the city. On arrival late in the evening a warming but a bit formal reception, then off to the room (superior room booked) which was OK in size overlooking the small piazza but with a rock hard bed and no useful curtains to keep the light out. Reading in the room was very difficult without proper lights.Fresh bathroom and good cleaning of the room, breakfast OK all the stuff was there.All-in all more lights in the room,better bed and better insulation -a lot of noice from the room next to me and from outside are points for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, great location, terrible bed”
Reviews.Author: Ien
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Accedemia November 18 till November 21 this year. We had to wait half an hour before everything was ok at check in. The lady at the reception wasn't very helpfull and during the paperwork she was talking to several collegues. After check in our room was not ready, but that was ok with us. We cold leave our bags in a special depot. The hotel is locates serveral meters from Trevi. Other places in Rome like Vatican and Colloseum is very walkable. Late afternoon we returned to the hotel and to our rooms. We had 2 executive rooms on the 4th floor. The rooms were hard to find. First with the elevator to the first floor, than through a hallway than another elevator to the 3rd floor and than steps to the 4th floor. Our room was ok, but not at night. Lots of noise from outside. And the bed was terrible. Hard, hard, hard. We were not in bed but up bed. The breakfastbuffet was ok with friendly ladies. The checkout was as terrible as the check-in. The man behind the reception was very rude and would not help us checking in on the computer (it is an Apple??!!) and printing the boardingpass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ciao035
Reviews.Content: Great Location, walking distance to all the main attractions and shopping strips. Our standard room was just that, the shower had a plastic curtain, and the water would go everywhere. The refrigerator was not working even though we told the Manager it was not fixed. Air conditioning not working probably I would not stay here again. The breakfast was very nice staff not so cheerful. July is a very hot month and you expect the refrigerator to be working.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, average service”
Reviews.Author: Anne187350
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could hardly be better for sightseeing in Rome. Right by the Trevi fountain, but still not too noisy, and all the big sites in walking distance. The hotel itself is OK value for money. The beds are, as others have pointed out, very hard. Fortunately, the room was large, and also had a sofa, which I actually slept on after the first night, and which was a lot more comfotable. The staff were friendly enough, but not very helpfull, and we had to wait in a corridor for a long time on arrival while they tried to work out which room to put us in- that seemed rather unprofessional. When we got to the room though, it was nice, big, quiet (for the centre of a big city), and a good temperature, not too hot but also not too cold, as you sometimes get with hotel aircon. Breakfast was good, better than I had expected for Italy. However, at certain times in the morning the breakfastroom was quite crowded- but that could easily be avoinded by getting up a little earlier, which is anyway a good idea in Rome, as you then get out and about ahead of the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly for holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TalPasternak
Reviews.Content: Very successful location ! Near to many sights, and to metro station. The ideal hotel for walking in Rome, not for only sleeping in hotel. Service leaves much to be desired. As a whole it is pure, silent and convenient. It is possible to upgradet conditions, having paid 30 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to sleep with bugs!”
Reviews.Author: headcleaner
Reviews.Content: If you really like the bugs, insects etc. you don't need to go south africa or somewhere like it. Just book Accademia hotel near fontana di trevi in rome! Stuff is really don't care about you, your needs or your help requests. They just stand there and say only just few memorized words with the same tone. Very dirty rooms with dirty fabric covered walls. No air-condition.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel great location a few step from the Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: PatnHel
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Rome recently, on a four night break using two hotels, the Accademia and the Concordia, some 200 metres apart, It was very interesting to see the difference. Both were for two adults, in a double room for two nights with breakfast. The Accademia was 120 Euros per night and the Concordia, 174 Euros per night. The reason for using two hotels started with both having an odd and extreme price hike for a night in the middle of a four night stay. Strangely, on different nights. Both hotels are in a great location and walking distance to everything. Anyway the Accademia was the first of the two hotels being the lower side of the Via de Tritone and very close to the Trevi Fountain. The reception Staff were helpful and welcoming as were the breakfast staff. The room was modern and clean but tiny with little space for storage. The room door just cleared the bed to open it and one person would have to give way to the other in order to move around anywhere in the room. That said the bathroom was huge in comparison and beautifully fitted. A star above the hotels awarded three. Our room was at the back overlooking the rear looking at courtyards and roofs and making the room quiet. Good aircon made for a good night sleep. Breakfast was very good. The usual cold spread with hot bacon, sausages and scrambled eggs. Self service in the moderate size breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MrBasilsDad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a three night stay in Rome. This hotel is in a superb location for all the sights. Big plus is the Trevi Fountain just around the corner. We had a room on the 5th floor which we could not fault. Bathroom was excellent. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept on, which is a huge benefit once you've pounded the streets of Rome for six or seven hours. Staff seemed friendly enough but can't really comment as we just used it as somewhere to sleep (very well!).

Reviews.Title: “WOULD STAY AGAIN...location great”
Reviews.Author: walt95
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband two children and mother in law we found the location of the hotel was excellent it is in walking distance to a lot of tourist attractions and a lot of nice eateries. The rooms were comfortable and clean however the bathroom was very small but you come to expect that in european hotels ....breakfast was included which was great....found the front reception staff mostly rude but if you can overlook that the location is a winner.....we also booked a three hour tour through a local guide when we got there it was great especially if you only have a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff -Perfect place to explore the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: ElToroChichester
Reviews.Content: Partner and I stayed for 5 nights. Hotel base is excellant - 50m from Trevi Fountain, set back off main road but close enough (20m) to bus stops, shops etc - all with no noisey crowds going passed your hotel-perfect! Staff were really helpful and nothing to much trouble A big 'Thank you' to Elena for all her help - eg; I asked for a chilled bottled of Prosecco on arrival and a 'nice' room which was duly done, emailed to ask about airport collection etc - all emailed back perfectly. I would say try and catch the main train from Airport to Termini station then the 175 bus which is 2 stops to the hotel so you get a feel for the area and can see.Small, modern bedroom. very clean. Fridge TV and internet. You can walk to most sites but the bus and metro tickets (daily combined 4euros) good value and safe. Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: plantagenon
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel very close (30 seconds walk) to the Trevi Fountain. Try and get the first floor room overlooking the square as its great to open the shutters and watch the world go by below. The breakfast at the hotel was great and the room very spacious and clean. There are a large number of wonderful restaurants within walking distance and a supermarket about 200 metres away where you can buy local food and very cheap, but great wine. Just around the corner is a bus stop where you can catch the Rome Explorer at a cheap price. It will take you to all the sights of Rome and you can get on and off as often as you want. There is a little gift shop next to the hotel where the people are truly wonderful and very helpful. If you want to see the colleseum then enter at the Palatine Hill entrance and purchase a ticket for the Palatine Hill, the forum and the colleseum. When you get to the colleseum you won't have to line up in a queue for a ticket. Just walk past the queue to the entrance and show your ticket. It will have you an hour in a queue.

Reviews.Title: “Accademia - a wonderful base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: perNakskov
Reviews.Content: 7 years in a row we have spent 5 to 7 days in Rome, and each time Hotel Accademia has accomodated us in a nice, clean and cosy room with a view over the lovely Piazza Accademia di S. Luca. After having a fine breakfast it has been possible to explore all the main attractions in Rome on feet. Dinner has usuyally been enjoyed in one of the excellent small restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. Hotel staff is friendly and helpfull, and it is nice to know that the hall porters "arrivederci" according to my dictionary can be translated to "see you again" aswell as "goodbye".

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel - superb Location!”
Reviews.Author: luuby
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 4 days in August07 with my boyfriend. Was absolutely lovely - everything you ask for. Step outside and you litterally step into the Trevvi fountain. Rooms were also lovely, although a little on the small side.....although when in Rome you dont tend to stay in the hotel that much! Also the lady on the reception desk was so, so, so helpful when I realised I didnt have my camera memory card, and even wrote me a list of all the local shops that would have one, and would be open at 8 in the evening!! All in all a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel... Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: aabdulmageed
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and turned out to be a good choice. Location is the number one reason, it is the closest to Trevi fountain and right next to a bus stop and 5 mins walk to metro... Room was bigger than expected... breakfast was good. A/C was not ok when we arrived, but hotel fixed it right away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Sydneyshopper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of nearly everything. It is just 50 m from the Trevi fountain! There is a supermarket close by and we bought snacks, fruit and drinks quite cheaply there and kept them in the hotel fridge. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. We upgraded to an executive room as there were 3 of us and this room looked like it had recently been refurbished. The breakfast each morning was very nice (one of the best we had in all of Italy) and had bacon, scrambled eggs, toast, fresh fruit as well as fresh pastries and hot coffee. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “rooms on 5th floor are nice”
Reviews.Author: mommy_tere
Reviews.Content: we got 3 rooms on the 5th floor and they were nice, new bedrooms and bathrooms decorated in dark wood. size is huge, knowing European hotels. the beds are nice -- they're like hospital beds... bathrooms are new, clean and nice. to reach the 5th floor, you must go down 4th and take a flight of stairs. inconvenient if you have big luggages but we asked the porter to do this for us so no sweat. breakfast was good. meats, breads, juices and fruits. enough to keep you filled for a day of sightseeing. i'm not sure why other reviews said the a/c is not on but it was when we were there a couple of weeks back. location can't be beat. a minute's walk to trevi fountain, a few blocks from the spanish steps and other shopping areas. it''s about a 15 min travel to the train station (roma termini) and 45-mins to the airport. there's a supermarket just across the street (near burger king) so that's convenient as well. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Mediocre Assistance, No Air until Summer”
Reviews.Author: ItalianTraveler2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last three nights of a two week trip through Italy. Mixed feelings. The location could not have been better. One or two staff members, including the driver picking us up from the airport, were extremely nice. The front desk staff were less than helpful, almost dismissive or snooty. The "superior" room was nicely remodeled, and included a bathtub. A little high, making it hard to get into, but at least it had a tub unlike many other hotels that did not. The air blew hot air. On inquiry, we were told they do not turn it on until June. It was warm, and opening the window caused us to have to listen to the never-ending compressor on the adjacent building. Since they advertise air conditioning, this was a problem for me. Also, they advertise internet, but then charge for it. Minor issue compared to the air. The breakfast buffet was adequate, in the middle of what we got in other hotels. The one-way airport transfer was a nice touch, and a real benefit! If the air worked, and the front desk manager was a bit nicer, this would have been a 4.5 rating. If I wanted a warm, stuffy room, I could have stayed in another, cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We checked in and left after seeing our room”
Reviews.Author: APeck
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 9 month old daughter and the room was so hot that she was sweating. We actually had to walk the streets looking for a hotel room so that she could sleep without being so hot. The hotel looks nothing like the photos and I definetly felt like we were scammed. I went and spoke to management and they told me they would call me back to discuss getting a refund for the 3 nights I did not stay and they never called. Since returning to the states, I have written them messages with no response. I was trying to give them time to make this right, but they have chosen not to do so. Do not stay here...There are no way you will feel satisfied with the hotel and I def wouldn't feel good sleeping here with my baby.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: acinorev
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break to Rome and stayed at the Accademia. As all of the reviews state this hotel is great for location -just round the corner from the Trevi Fountain - which was always a popular spot for tourists. All other attractions were within fairly easy walking difference - and we managed to walk to the Vatican, Pantheon, river, St Peters, etc from the hotel. the weather was so warm - 20 degrees on our last day. Breakfast in the hotel was really nice - choice of cereal, toast, fruit, eggs and really nice pastries! The staff were really helpful - on arrival the porter immediately gave us a map and marked the spot of the hotel! Much needed! The city is wonderful, plenty to see, lovely weather, great food - and although the euro makes it a little expensive -ie for buying a simple cup of coffee! - its stil well worth the trip. We pre booked transfers from the airport thru thomas cook - this took a bit longer than we thought - but was an experience travelling around the city, in and out of the narrow cobbled streets! Our transfer back was just as hectic - so if you do have transfers booked -ensure they allow enough time - ours took almost 2 hours!! would definately recomnnend rome and the accademia for choice of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you book a superior room”
Reviews.Author: Copenhagen_girl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Accademia just around the corner from the Trevi Fountain four times now. My parents have stayed there at least fifteen times over the past ten years. The other reviews cover most of the details - one important thing to be aware of when booking Hotel Accademia is that the difference between the standard rooms and the superior rooms is huge. Standard rooms are quited dated, dark, gloomy and the beds are terrible. The superior rooms are excellent with new furniture, refurbished bathrooms and they tend to be bigger rooms as well. If you look through the traveler pictures on TA you can see the difference. I would never stay in one of the standard rooms. Breakfast is really good for Italian standards. Location is superb! ... and yes... staff is rude. Except Paolo who is always friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: opgator
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week and were extremely happy with our choice. The location is fantastic (2 to 20 minutes walk to the main attractions). Our room was small with two beds pushed up together, but had everything we needed and was always clean. We did not spend much time in our room, it was just a place to sleep and very convenient if in the middle of a day we had to change the shoes (lot's of walking = lot's of blisters) or use the bathroom (I don't remember seeing any public restrooms in Rome). Breakfast in this hotel was another story. It was the BEST breakfast we have ever had. You have to try their pastries, they are delicious; I can't compare them to anything I have ever tried before. I would stay there again just for the breakfast itself! There are numerous grocery stores with fresh Italian bread, cheese, vegetables and wine; we stopped there sometimes to pick up the food for snack or our dinner (food there was always good, bread in particular, and saved us a lot of money). Also, there are numerous Cafés around the hotel where you can have an excellent cappuccino for 1 euro and a very good local sandwich (quite different from American) for about 1.5 euro; this was always our lunch. We found the food in these cafés was actually better than what we had in fancy restaurants for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Brekfast, Value for Money.”
Reviews.Author: ab0utand0ut
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic spot, we got off to a rocky start where they forgot to pick us up from the airport BUT this ended up being great as our taxi driver who did take us to the hotel was a huge source of local knowledge and this was one highlight to Rome anyway! The hotel staff were professional, helpful and very understanding. They upgraded us from a small (but cute) room to a suite and the offered us a free walking tour of Rome to make up for their error at the airport. The room was always clean (they even folded clothes left on thefloor!!), the breakfast was huge and coffee not so bad. they had heaps of advice and suggestions and it was the one hotel we never got lost trying to find! They are surrounded by heaps of restaraunts and not 2 mins from the Spanish Steps and well a wee bit of shopping! Great hotel to start a trip with and the location PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LOCATION & VALUE FOR MONEY!!”
Reviews.Author: WeenaHill
Reviews.Content: Price: Me and my Boyfriend stayed at the hotel for a week in January. Our room wasnt the biggest, but it was amazing value for money. Before i found this hotel online (at a discounted price from lastminute.com) I made a reservation at a hostel, as we were traveling on a budget. But this hotel worked out to be a similar price which was a bargain considering it was an ensuit room with breakfast included, unlike the hostel. Food: The breakfast is great!!! A real variety of foods and perfect If you are traveling on a budget! If so its a good idea to eat loads at breakfast and have a big lunch, as it is more expensive to eat in the evenings. Most of the restaurants near Trevi foutain have set menus for lunch, so you can have a decent meal for €5-7. Location: The location is amazing! Everything is within walking distance and if your feeling lazy one day you can take the metro, which is a 5mintue walk away which only costs €1 for a single trip, or €4 for an all day travel pass. Staff: I avoided asking the staff for help after i read reviews they werent very polite. And its true to say they arent the most welcoming, but its a small price to pay for a great hotel!!! Internet: There is a mac computer in the lobby that you can use, at a cost of €3 an hour. Or the Cafe next door has free WIFI. The Cafe, located next to the Hotel is also a great place to grab a cheap coffee. €3 for 2 drinks. I would recommend this place to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excelent location, great room”
Reviews.Author: Daniel-FLN-BR
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great new bathroom, cozy bed, frigobar, near Fontana di Trevi and Pantheon, you can easily walk to all touristic attractions on Rome (except Vaticano). 15 minutes walk from Coliseum, great staff, internet costs 3 euros pepr 1 hour. The waiter of the breakfast is very rude, but all waiters in Italy are. By the way, the breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta1st_timer
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a prime location and was within walking distance of most major sights (for those who don't mind walking). Literally a 3 minute walk to Trevi Fountain. Tons of city buses right outside the front door and only a 3-4 block walk to the metro. Lobby was nice and clean. Front desk staff were "hit or miss" - concerning friendliness. We had the family room, which was very tight but clean. Bathroom completely updated. Internet service very expensive (3 euros for 15 min). Would definitely stay here again because the location was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding location, quiet rooms, good breakfast, easy bus routes”
Reviews.Author: MysticFlowers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in mid November. No rain and mild weather. The hotel was better than expected, quiet, great location, nice small mediterrean hotel rooms. The conceirge was helpful but not talkative. Breakfast included real capuccionos (sp). Loved hearing the soft bells from local churches every 15 minutes, very romantic. Our bed was OK but a bit on the hard side. Rooms were kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location and room rate, terrible concierge”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Cruise2
Reviews.Content: We (friend and I) stayed at this hotel for 5 nights prior to a cruise. The room rate was favorable (200 euro per night), the location was fantastic (right behind Trevi Fountain), and transport from the airport (awesome, as it's quite a distance) and a good, hot breakfast were included in the price. Relative to other Italy hotels, nice, big lobby. Room was standard. Any hotel that has windows I can actually open is a big plus for me. My only complaint was the concierge service. We arrived late on a Tuesday night, and I had pre-arranged some tours for Wednesday, so that wouldn't be a wasted day. Having always had excellent service from concierge staff, I figured we would get recommendations from them on how to best fill up the remaining 3 full days. Big mistake. Whenever we asked them a question, we were made to feel like we were interrupting them. Maybe we were, but it's unprofessional to convey that to your customer. For instance, we asked for recommendations on good tours that are a little 'off the beaten path', and the response was "I can't tell you that. I don't know what you want to see." We asked about making reservations for the Borghese Gardens, and were asked if WE HAD THE PHONE NUMBER. We asked for a restaurant recommendation where we could get a good, typical Italian meal, someplace frequented by locals, and were sent to a place called Al Fredo. Very hard to find, and very expensive. The only locals were the staff. Needless to say, we did not tip them, as we usually do when we get satisfactory service. All in all, I would recommend this property to a friend, but would warn them that they'll be on their own, in terms of how spend their precious time in this magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel to see Rome - Great Staff, Good Value, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Wiltsfolk
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Accademia is the perfect Hotel to see Rome, with its location just off the Trevi Fountain unbeatable, the hotel is quiet yet just a 20 second walk away from Trevi. As it is an old building the room was small, (this is not a modern Marriott or Crowne Plaza but who wants that anyway?), ours was well furnished, comfortable with lots of character, and looking out through the shutters you felt a part of the city. The staff were all warm and welcoming, but what makes the hotel magical is its location. step out the front, turn left and you walk 20 yards to the magic of the Trevi fountain. We had 3 days being the complete tourists ( Vatican, Ancient Rome, bernini's fountains) and it was all just a 20 minute walk away. Coming back in the evening and the restaurants are right there - we completely fell in love with the City. we would go back without a thought.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel if you really want to stay here”
Reviews.Author: tacAustralia
Reviews.Content: After booking and paying for 4 nights 12 months in advance we were told on arrival aftera very long flight from Australia that they were over booked. They transferred us to a sister hotel but this caused problems as we had a transfer booked from the hotel to Civitavecchia on departure. No apology either. We can't comment on the hotel facilities as we never got to see or use them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: californialily1
Reviews.Content: I wanted to just say that the hotel is not bad for a three star. The breakfast (included) is okay for the price and the room is very clean which is a must when we travel. The location is outstanding. When it states it is close to the Trevi Fountain they are not kidding. We were also able to walk to the Colosseum, Forum, Palatine Hill, Spanish Steps and Pantheon. I highly recommend this hotel for its location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location. great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bowlswidow
Reviews.Content: we had five nights stay here and must say we where very pleased with the hotel. had a lovely room, not the greatest of views, but it was really clean. (cleaned evey day) reasonable size bathroom (but only half bath but that was okay as i like only showers). The breakast was very good. A choice of cereal, juice continental meats , eggs and fruit and bread toasted or otherwise. the best time to go down to breakfast was before 8.30am as after that it got quite full. The staff were very friendly helpful and personable. I looked before we went at the reviews on this site and was a bit sceptical, but in all honesty we really liked it and for the location exactly where you would want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Bed is hard as a rock”
Reviews.Author: travelerfromsea
Reviews.Content: I realize this is a 3 star hotel but this is the hardest bed I've ever bounced off of! The hotel is way smaller than pictured. Great location but not good enough to make up for the poor room. Moving to the Sofitel tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “BYO pillow and night goggles, girls.”
Reviews.Author: lyntel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed here before and recommended it to others because of the great location, but my recent stay as a solo female traveller left a lot to be desired. I scored Room 453 which was a cross between Harry Potter's cupboard and Anne Frank's attic. The bed was hard, the pillows ancient, and the lighting so poor I couldn't find dark clothes in my suitcase, much less read a book. I also had to stay one night at the hotel on my way back from Amalfi which was pre-booked and pre-paid before I left Australia, and confirmed before I left for Sorrento. When I arrived back at the hotel around 9.30 p.m. I found the room had been given to someone they "didn't know was coming", and I was sent trundling off into the night to another hotel around the corner. I doubt if I could recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is fine - just fine - but the location is unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: joeywhineray
Reviews.Content: I couldn't think of a better location for a hotel in Rome. It is in a piazza next to the Trevi Fountain so you are surrounded by restaurants, bars and shops and you can walk to all tourist destiantions (both the Colesseum and Vatican are about 30mins lovely walk away and everything else closer). The hotel is also quiet, so even though you are in a bustling area, there was no noise in the rooms. The hotel itself is not great, but its adeqaute. The rooms are pretty small and theres not much really more to say. But it fitted our requirements perfectly. Some reveiws talk about the rudeness of the staff - we found that to be the case with most of the peple in Rome tho! Most of the waiters, barstaff, shopkeepers all seemed rather grumpy, but the staff in the hotel listened to any requests so they were fine. Breakfast, again was fine, not excellent but there was choice and lots of food. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- terrible service”
Reviews.Author: anthlett
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous location, so close to the Trevi and Spanish steps. Our room was clean and quite spacious with great views. Good value for money but don't expect any warm welcomes, smiles or pleased to see you greetings. We arrived at the Accademia after staying in a wonderful hotel in Positano were the service was wonderful to be greeted by quite the opposite at the Accademia, and it didn't get any better the 3 nights that we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “great location, too expensive for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeBeth
Reviews.Content: The location is great, walking distance to most of Rome attraction, near the Metro for the vatican nad bus lines to all of Rome. Beside the location there is not that much to say. My room was VERY, VERY SMALL, a nice modren room but no view and I could hardly move. The breakfast is very good. The AC was good (very important during the summer). The front desk people are not friendly, no smiles and just answer your question with no extra information. They give you the feeling that it is not their job. It is not a bad hotel, and the location is wonderful, but I think there may be better deals in Rome for 100E a night for a solo traveler in a tiny room. To use the PC (only one in the loby) They charge 3E for 24 hours. The problem is that if you do not use the hour when you start to work on the PC, latter the PC is always taken by others and you lose the time which is left. Be aware of the taxi drivers who try to charge you 1 E for each bag you have, including women handbag and a computer bag... you need to talk about your bags before you get in. Taxi is very expensive !

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IslaGael
Reviews.Content: I stayed that the Accademia for a school trip during our stay in Rome. We were there for 8 days and I loved the hotel. It was very clean, the staff was ver friendly as well as accomidating. It was great that they had a computer for the guests to use for I believe about 5 Euro during your stay. (it made it easy to email friends and family while you were away). All of the rooms that my classmates and I stayed in wre a great size and located on the side with somewhat of a view. THe room that my friend and I were in was two floors aboe the lobby and had a very of the road leading to the Trevi fountain! The greatest part for me was that the hotel is so central in Rome that we were literally walking distance to EVERYHITNG that we wanted to see or to the bus station that could take us places. THe Trevi Fountain was literally around the corner from our hotel! The breakfast was great too (not a huge fan of warm milk, but that was everywhere we went in Europe so you get used to it). I would strongly reccomend this hotel to friends and family. I would even stay there again on another trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: junglejam
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from our Roma holiday and we stayed accademia hotel. The room was very small and basic. Bathroom was very basic and shower was too small - even though I am a small person, I could hardly fit in the shower. The great attraction of this hotel is the location though and if for no other reason, we may return again for this reason alone. Breakfast was actually quite OK but the service staff a the front desk need an energy & charisma transplant as they just seemed to ignore all the guests unless approached directly and even them only were prepared to oblige at a time that suited themsleves. We have actually stayed here before and it was different as the room previously was larger and the attention from the staff better - maybe there have been changes but I think they need to pull up their socks and give a bit back in terms of service and also consider what they charge for what was little more than a closet of a room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: JPRob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent a long weekend at the Hotel Accademia and it has been a fantastic experience. The service was excellent, the staff were friendly, our room was clean and well furnished and the location was simply out of this world. When we arrived we were upgraded to a Superior Room which, though small was decorated to a very high standard and had everything we needed including an ensuite bathroom, mini bar, LCD TV and lockable safe. The rooms were cleaned daily. Breakfast was very good with lots of variety - bacon, sausages, eggs, cakes, pastries, rolls, juice, cereals etc. We also made use of the large lounge area downstairs with tea and coffee making facilities. The location is absolutely perfect for romantic evening strolls through the centre of Rome and is just a 30 second walk away from the Trevi fountain. Our room was very quiet and soundproofed, and the easy to operate air conditioning unit meant that it remained cool all night. I am really suprised by some of the negative reviews that I have read about this hotel. We found it excellent and we will use it again when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth price, poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: finland__9
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults + baby) stayed in "superior room". The room was very small, there was constant loud noise from outside (near Trevi). We had to take 2 elevators and some stairs so really amazing how this room was chosen for family with kid in trolley. Price was 200eur/night. We had booked first Hotel White (soundproof Executive room) for 230eur/night a month in advance but they canceled on arrival day due to "problems with room". So they downgraded us from 4star to 3star hotel and clearly overcharged that and the room was completely opposite what we booked in first place (small, noisy). I would stay away from this business. To give some credit, the lobby staff at Hotel Accademia were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tredon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in June 2009 and we had a pleasant stay in this hotel. The room was modern with traditional aspects, which was perfect for my taste. I also found the room to be clean and tidy, but what really added to our stay was the location of the hotel, it was walking distance to almost everything. Would I recommend this hotel?.....................yes, but beware it is quite pricy for you get, along with the rest of Rome. Rome itself is amazing, but you will have to probably have to re-morgage for a trip especially with our poor performing £ at the moment (IE 6E for three pieces of friut. But it is a must do trip though!

Reviews.Title: “What' so great about Trevi!”
Reviews.Author: HHV
Reviews.Content: While waiting to be able to enter the apartment I had rented in Rome (located near Campo dei Fiori), I had to find a hotel for one night, did so last minute by internet (Venere) and wound up here, at some distance that is from where I rented. The Accademia is a fine hotel really, and is called so because of its address, Piazza Dell’Accademia di San Luca, which is a very small square - more of a triangle really - just off the Via del Tritone, where there is a busstop almost right at your doorstep, number 175. The Via del Tritone connects Piazza Barberini with the Via del Corso, if that means anything to you. Roman busses at rush hour – and at any other hour - are sheer tragedy, so I took a taxi from Termini and paid 8 euros. I had a good room (luxury level though, it seemed), streetside but quiet, with a very modern bathroom for which I paid 150 instead of the normal 200. It wasn’t very large, but adequate and clean. Service at the desk was friendly, but it might have helped that I speak Italian. Breakfast next morning was okay, especially if you consider the normal appalling level of breakfast in Italy. The hotel advertises itself as a three star, and they are right. And yes, 200 would be expensive, even for Rome. The only thing I didn’t like about the hotel – but for which it is praised by many on this site – is the location. And I suppose that accounts for the price. I myself would never willingly accept a hotel location so near to the Trevi fountain. It means that hordes of people will be passing by from dawn till nightfall, and that, if you buy a cappuccino on a terrace at the Via del Tritone, you pay 5 euros. Two days later, on a terrace at the Via Merulana, I paid 1.50. At Campo dei Fiori you will pay 3. The area around Trevi is heavily tourist infested, noisy, full of cheap shops and (mostly) bad restaurants, where no decent Italian would ever care to sit down. Like the area around the Spanish steps it is a circus. People who live there are complaining for years now about the mess that is made by – especially – younger visitors. Apart from the heavy tourist traffic in the direction of the Trevi fountain, I have always found the area around the Via del Tritone dull. If you want to be chic, choose Via Veneto, if you prefer oldfashioned Italian charm, choose the area behind Via Arenula and the Tiber, or the area between Navona and the Tiber, or settle for Trastevere, which is lovely too. You won’t avoid the tourists there either, and you never will in Rome, but it is much nicer and much more Italian. And if you ‘d like to stay for a week or longer, rent an apartment. But, like I said, with the Accademia there ’s nothing wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: paulacork
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews along the same lines, let me reiterate that the best thing about this hotel is the location. Uncomfortable beds, rude staff, badly cooked breakfast. The whole experience was a struggle. I was a solo traveller and the chill at the Reception when coming back to the hotel each time was noticeable. The impression I got from the staff is that they really don't care - the only person who was in any way pleasant was the "bell-boy" but he expected to be highly rewarded! I would suggest that you go somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Fountain di Trevi's neighbour”
Reviews.Author: Leya31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located near the fountain di Trevi (approximately 50m). But you should be ready to see a lot of tourists going to fountain. Don't worry about noises from the street. You'll hear nothing if window is closed. The hotel inside is quite cosy. It has 3 floors and breakfast room on the 0 floor. Breakfast was normal, without any luxury, but enough to feeling full. All dishes had good quality. Room is really small, but we came back to hotel only at night and it wasn't a problem. Only one negative information about room: one of the wall was so dirty!!! I'd recommended this hotel for tourists who aren't going to spend a lot of time in it. And my advice for all Rome's visitors is take the most comfortable boots you have.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe Accademia's website”
Reviews.Author: Ninking
Reviews.Content: No doubt - the location is great. But there are some nusty details one should take in account before choosing this hotel: 1. The double bed is actually two single beds pushed together. 2. Brekfast contains no vegetables (at least on March), and overall is rather restricted to basics. 3. A dining room is small, so if you come at about 9 - you should wait or sit outside it on unserved tables. 4. The Hotel's web list of services mentions twice that in standart room one may get free WiFi, however in fact wireless costs you 3 EUR per hour. 5. The News Café is not impressive at all. Accept all this we had no battaries in a TV remote control and a safe was locked. If you do not care all mentioned above - the rest is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: danielaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its location. All reception staff were extremely rude and arrogant. We were presented with a room that was not ready and the replacement room we were eventually given had remnants of the previous guest in the bathroom....will not go into detail! Daily room cleaning was poor. I did not appreciate having my toiletry bag left in the bidet. The travel brochure we based our choice on had lovely rooms pictured but unfortunately we were given one of the unrenovated rooms. Trying to discuss this with staff at reception was impossible as we were arrogantly dismissed. This was the worst hotel we stayed at during our European holiday. I strongly suggest you find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: poppy033
Reviews.Content: Was recommended this hotel by someone who had already stayed there. Without doubt, the location is excellent, very quiet and safe and in a great location for sightseeing. For the price paid, my main problems with this hotel were as follows: * Reception staff were not particularly helpful, friendly or welcoming on arrival. Subsequent to this, when we asked for assistance in confirming some tour details we were initially flatly refused. The staff member even refused to look the number up for us, so we could call for ourselves. (Mind you, after this we left to go to an internet cafe to look up the number ourselves, which we found easily, once we got back the staff member had gone ahead and contacted the tour company anyway, but this was frustrating as we'd just spent money at an internet cafe to do it ourselves!). * After a 5 week trip in Europe, this was the most uncomfortable bed. * Our particular room, was in a location with a lot of people passing in the corridor etc. It was also located right nearby the housekeepers trolley and the housekeepers had a good 30 min chat right outside our door in the morning. * Breakfast with pretty poor, staff were rude and the coffee was awful. As we had to return to Rome a few days after our initial stay, we decided to choose another hotel as we were so unhappy with the Accademia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you don't expect tpp much”
Reviews.Author: maya_ww
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in October. Great hotel. Very clean, nice and new furniture, very good breakfast. Of coures excellent location-you don't need any bus!! Best hotel we stayed in Italy. If yoy are not used to Hilton standards (it's not fancy ), you will enjoy it a lot. Our room was quite big, so I guess there are different types of rooms. The staff is friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ask Management for Help”
Reviews.Author: Peef
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel October 2007 and were aware it was undergoing major refurbishment. We were assigned to a refurbished 'executive room'. These rooms are small beyond belief, even for a European city. We could have lived with the size. as we have done many times over at other hotels, were it not for the incredible heat in the room. We advised reception about the temperature in the room and they sent a technician to look at the air conditioning unit and he reported that it was not working and he could not get it to work. At the same time there are notices all over the hotel advising not to open windows for security reasons, presumably because there was scaffolding outside and this is obviously a security risk. So we virtually cooked in this little box. We had the most uncomfortable stay ever. On our return we emailed the booking agent who contacted the hotel and eventually after several weeks we were advised that the hotel's air conditioning is switched off in September as it is not needed and that is why it was not working!?!? I don't know if this is a true fact but if it is it's ludicrous and if so why didn't they tell us while we were staying there. If it isn't true then what an awful lie to make to customers. We have since been offered a free night's stay at the hotel - big deal! I would say think very hard about your hotel choice, it may be in a convenient position but I think they think because of this they can get away with poor customer service. I would much rather sleep in comfort. Vote with your feet.

Reviews.Title: “Around the corner from Trevi Fountain!”
Reviews.Author: cherienian
Reviews.Content: Great Location! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jonsey30
Reviews.Content: Wow! Location: amazing! We walked everywhere from here. Trevi fountain seconds away!! Coluseum 10 mins, Vatican city 40 mins walk. Room: very smart and well designed. we were upgraded to an executive room for nothing! Breakfast: bountiful and delicious, a great start for a day of sight seeing! Staff: really pleasnat and efficient. There was a real mix of nationalities staying here too which is nice to experience. Cannot recommend it more highly, a great hotel in which we would definatly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: MadHerts
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Rome and stayed at this hotel. Its location is superb, being just a short walk from Trevi fountain, but more importantly, it is very near the bus stop for the city tour bus (110). We did not plan to be at the hotel for long periods of the day as there is too much to visit in the city. As a central base, it cannot be beaten. Room: We stayed in a Superior room (253) which was quite adequate for two adults, a good size and firm bed, TV, fridge and very clean bathroom. The only problem was with the heating, we couldnt turn it off! It was also rather dark. Breakfast: A good, help yourself breakfast bar with plenty of choice available. Staff were not over friendly but they were efficient and extremly busy. Lobby: Receptionist(s) spoke good English and were able to assist with all of our enquiries. Eating out: We found that the resteraunt next door to the left of the hotel was perfect for our needs. Be aware, there are plenty of resteraunts nearby that try to entice you in by their staff standing outside. This is because the food and service is not good enough to make you want to go there! View: If we had wanted a room with a view, we wouldnt have picked one in the city centre. Getting about: I think we hit trumps on this. We found (through this site) a cab firm called Rome Cabs ([--]). They were superb, offerering much more than a standard cab firm (see seperate review). Highly recommended. Tour Bus. Therre is a bus stop just around the corner from the hotel for the 110 tour bus. This is an excellent way of getting your bearings and getting around. The hotel suggest that you buy your tickets from the kiosk over the road. You have to buy a two day pass from them . We managed to pay on the bus for just one day. We will definatly return to Rome, probably stay at the same hotel and certainly use the same cab firm.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, Great location. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: kawaiJerusalem
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, and were pleased with it. Nothing fancy, very moderate room, but clean and comfortable. The location is great - just a few steps from Fontana Di Trevi, and a short walk to all of the famous locations in the historic city. The rooms were quiet, but the view consisted of very close buildings. The breakfast was good and ample, but I would have expected in Italy to get a decent coffee - not the usual filter crap. The staff were moderatly frieldly. In the lobby there is an internet station with 5 euro charge per stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ribbler
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Accademia Hotel in January 2006. It was clean and well ran, with nice decor. The best thing about this hotel though is its location in the historical quarter; literally 30 seconds walk from the Trevi Fountain! This makes it a great base as the Coloseum is a 20 minute walk, while the Spanish Steps are about 15 minute walk away. Although we ended up getting a taxi to the Vatican, there's a bus stop straight outside the hotel. One minor point re: the Trevi fountain; sometimes it is besieged by rose sellers and other peddlers so it is important to be vigilant at all times - that said, we didn't really have a problem. Looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: SteveLytham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for 4 nights in early March. Our expectations were to have a safe base for our daily trips. The rooms provided were quite good, if you're expectations are realistic. Plain and simple,clean with good bathroom facilities.The breakfasts were good and allowed you to fill up for the day but as expected busy at peak time,(9.30).The Staff were friendly and helpful.We stayed in Room 154,there was a poor view from the window so we kept the shutters closed most of the time.This wasn't a problem as having a good view from the window wasn't a priority.If we were to return to Rome,having seen the hotels available there, we would pick the Accademia again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but be careful - very noisy, small and building work going on”
Reviews.Author: TravelledNorwichUK
Reviews.Content: Executive rooms were very very small and too noisy. We read all of the wonderful reviews and so decided to book. We emailed in advance for a quiet room. The Executive room we were given was very small, could not pass each other around the bed, it was far too small, a cupboard really. The design meant that your neighbours bathroom took a large proportion of your room so you could hear every personal function your neighbour did. We had a shock being woken at 6.00 with a bang, it was next door having a shower, it may as well have been in our room, it was so loud. Our room was at the back of the hotel, building work was going on, the air condition ducts fixed to the rear of the building were very very noisy and we could hear the lift stating which floor it had arrived on/lift mechanisms all night. It was so hot, the air conditioning was not available and we could not leave the window open as it was too noisy/smelly from the air conditioning ducts/kitchens below. We asked to be moved but they were full and told we could only return to see an alternative room at 2.00 in the afternoon which would have ruined our day. The Executive rooms appeared to be extensions to the main hotel at the back. The design of the room was lovely, very modern. The staff were very polite. The hotel is very simple. Consists of rooms to stay, small reception, small breakfast room and one main lift which can carry four people. There is no place to sit in the room and it does not have a separate lounge except the small reception area. However, we explored the hotel and came across a lounge which was for superior rooms only and had coffee facilities and free internet. There are three types of rooms, superior, executive and original. The older rooms are very shabby but larger. There is building work going on throughout the interior of the hotel and looks like it will take a very long time as they are going to be doing most of the hotel, but it did not interfere with our stay, except the dust. Wonderful location very central to the sites. We arrived at a weekend which was very busy, Italian families stay here over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore the city from”
Reviews.Author: Tapelia
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just come back from a 2 night stay at the Hotel Accademia and a wonderful trip to Rome. The Hotel is located in a relatively quiet square between an extremely busy road and the almost always chaotic Trevi Fountain, so it’s not the quietest place ever. The staff at the front desk were helpful and understated, with a porter to walk us to our room and happy to communicate with us in English. This isn’t the most luxurious hotel we’ve stayed in, but given that we really didn’t go to Rome to spend time in our hotel room it was exactly what we needed. We stayed in room 104, a spacious room located pretty much directly above the front door of the hotel. The room had 2 single beds pushed together to form the double we had asked for, and had space for a couch, TV, large dressing table and mini-bar without feeling at all crowded. The extremely high ceilings really added to the sense of space, and the windows actually opened (and had shutters that worked)! Given the location of the room and the hotel it wasn’t exactly quiet, but we managed to sleep with the window open without much trouble. We could have done without the music pumping from the News Café attached to the hotel, but the ability to walk to most of the main attractions more than made up for the slightly Spartan feel of the room and any noise. The room was very clean and very light, although storage space was limited. The bathroom was a good size – no bath but a nice shower and enough light. One thing I really didn’t like was that the ‘hair-drier’ was one of those wall-mounted units that look (and act) like a vacuum-cleaner with the air flow reversed; but it’s better than nothing I suppose. There was a stand-alone air-conditioning unit pushed under the dressing table in the room proper, but given the time of year we didn’t do more than casually glance in its direction. Overall, this hotel suited our needs down to the ground – somewhere to sleep and refresh ourselves before heading off to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kpdorset
Reviews.Content: Plus points - excellent location close to Trevi Fountain, very good food, clean. Minus points - reception staff initially could not find our booking, rooms on the small size. Overall experience - good.

Reviews.Title: “location 10”
Reviews.Author: pecinha
Reviews.Content: a friend of mine told me to stay at accademia which is located 2 blocks from fontana di trevi. it´s one of the best location in rome. near to everething,spanish steps,old city,coliseum etc and near thebig avenues to take buses etc...it was a promotion 150 euros for a triple room and we had to change our room because the heater was not working. what a good surprise, we stayed in the new refurbished area. try to ask for this new area. breakfast is very good. staff is ok, nothing special. After looking other areas like near train staition,trastevere etc y can tell you this is one of the best areas to stay and this hotel was a good surprise (my only complaint was about the carpets. they sould clean it more often)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pixie16
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be much closer to the Trevi Fountain. It is literally about a 20-30 second walk. Check in was fine, English speaking so no problem. There was a porter to assist with luggage to room. The rooms were quite nice. No view but that was OK as there were renovations being done during my stay. Breakfast was included which was plentiful. So you could have a good meal to see you through the day. Once again, great location. Close to shops, restaurants, an internet cafe right next door but the hotel does have one computer for guests. Most major tourist sites were within walking distance. The hop-on/hop-off bus tours are an excellent way to find your way around. Would recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but with room to improve”
Reviews.Author: losven
Reviews.Content: Considering the price level our expectations were not high. However as many other reviewers say the location is truly excellent. Hotel renovations are still ongoing. According to the hotel they should have finished in November, but as far as we could see the project will have to go on for quite some time. We were given a newly renovated room on the third floor (315). Tight, sure, a rock hard bed (even for Italian standards) but a very contemporary and nice design that really appealed to us. The big problem was that the temperature in the room could not be controlled. Rome was cold, our room was not. We averaged 25-26 degrees centigrade. As the air conditioning was turned off, the only option available to cool the room was to open the window. However, given the scaffolding outside the staff recommended us not to leave any windows open. The staff really tried solving the heat problem but eventually we were moved to a new room (306). Now that room was a completely different story, loose carpet on the floor, cracked tiles in the extremely small bathroom, a very worn sofa etc etc. But we did not care, the room had a normal temperature and a somewhat softer bed, we could sleep again. We saw some signs of the older rooms being renovated. Give it a year or two and the Accademia may well become the best value hotel available in Rome. The Travel Roma group of hotels seem to have high ambitions. For now just make sure you get a renovated room for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Skippy_Kangaroo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, like most review state. Around the corner from the Trevi Fountain and reasonable walking distance to many great places around Rome. We were very happy with this choice, all the ammeneties were great (shower etc). Breakfast was a very nice selection. Our room had no view due to the renovations going on outside, but I'm sure this is just a once off thing. We were disappointed to have lost our room once we returned from a 2 day tour out of Rome, again due to renovations. This meant we were sent to an alternate hotel (which wasn't half a nice, see Hotel Anglo Americano, Rome). Still, Hotel Accademia was a great place to stay. Helpful staff, excellent location, great facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: london18
Reviews.Content: BOOK THIS NOW!!!!!!!!!!!! Location great, breakfast great, staff great, rooms great. Just around the corner from The Trevi fountain Had a brilliant time

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pengee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good if you go to Rome for a short stay. Yes, the rooms are small but after all you are not spending your time in the hotel room. The only nag I would have about the rooms are the lack of English speaking tv channels (one likes to watch whilst getting ready) and the basics to make a cup of tea in the morning (another English tradition!). The hotel is currently undergoing a refurb & the room we stayed in had already been completed and was comfortable & clean. The staff are helpful & the breakfast good, especially the delicious rolls (the best Ive ever tasted). As for the location - fantastic. Trevi fountain just around the corner as is the bus stop for the city tour (do that first to get an overview). It is situated about halfway between the Colessium and the Vatican and so everything is within walking distance. There are nice restaurants & good shopping also within walking distance. Dont stay anywhere else is my recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wickedtraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six day trip to Rome and picked this 3* hotel from the Thomas Cook signature brochure for its location to all the usual tourist sights. We had an excellent stay, as a general rule I never upgrade as we don't spend alot of time in the hotel rooms and this was no different. The room faced onto the street was bright and clean with a mini bar which you could also use to keep drinks you had purchased cold and of course a TV. The bathroom was adequate and clean. There is currently work going on to generally upgrade the hotel but we were never awoken with the noise. The breakfast is a welcome start to the day 7 -10.30am. Hot and cold food is available which you can just help yourself to as much as you want. The hotel staff and helpful and friendly. We were not disapointed with the location the trevi fountain is maybe a 100yds down the road!!! the main shopping street is one block away. the colleseum 15-20 mins walk and the vatican 30 mins. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Accademia was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: RH155
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, close to Trevi Fountain. Walking distance to virtually everything. Service great - we arrived in early morning to drop off our bags, planning to wander around to fill time until check in later that day only to be ushered to a seat and newspapers and told they would have our room ready for us in 10 minutes (several hours before check in time) at no extra charge so we could settle in and have a shower straight away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Where2Next1011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 3 nights at the Hotel Accademia for our 1 year wedding anniversary and we were both very happy with this choice. The location: This is by far the best thing about this hotel. It is literally a 30 second stroll to the Trevi Fountain. Rome is extremely walkable and we found we were never more than 10 minutes walk from all of the best sites. We even walked to Vatican City from the hotel and that took maybe 20 minutes. Location was the most important thing to us when we were deciding where to stay and this hotel fit the bill perfectly. Hotel Bar: Very friendly and good service. We showed up at 2:30 AM after a night out and there were still people sitting there. We asked the bartender what time they closed. He said they closed a half hour ago but he invited us to sit down and have a drink anyway. And with a friendly smile! Breakfast: All you can eat which is always a good thing. The hot items were eggs, bacon and these tiny sausage things. The sausages were pretty good, the eggs nothing special and kind of wet. Not runny, really, but almost watery. They had a selection of good cereals, pastries, yoghurt, fruit, cold meat and cheese, so I never felt hungry after breakfast and everything was very good. My husband said the coffee was excellent. The beds and the room: Yes, it is true what the other reviews have said about the beds being very hard. If you like a firm mattress, you won't have any problem here! But after long hot days of walking around Rome, I never had any trouble sleeping! The room was very clean. The bathroom was spotless and the shower was fantastic with great water pressure! The sheets and blankets nice, crisp and clean smelling. Our window overlooked the hotel bar and we never had any noise problems at all. There are some renovations going on at the hotel, but nothing I would call a problem. Overall, I thought this was a lovely little hotel in a location that really can't be beat. I would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “the location is the main draw”
Reviews.Author: janes1053
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is the location. It is seconds from the Trevi Fountain and walking distance to lots of attractions. Another plus was free wifi. The rooms need a major overhaul. The air conditioner was inefficient. I left a skirt and my ipod in the room. The skirt made it to the lost and found. Mu ipod was never recovered. I would probably select another hotel next time when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: maltaFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central, walking distance to all attractions, cannot beat the location. Restaurants and shops close by. The room was small but clean. We had an outside room and it was very noisy during the night and the beds are rock hard. Felt like we were sleeping on wooden planks. Breakkast was pretty good and the receptionists were helpful with tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Huskieinrooland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in mid June 2007. It is a little hard to find as it is tucked away on a side street. However, it is worth the effort. The rooms were clean and relatively large. We had no view but we were pleasantly surprised by the room size. There were no irons in the room and no ironing room. When we asked for an iron we were told it was "not possible" and we would have to use a laundry. The breakfast was good with a reasonable selection of breads, cheeses, eggs etc. The attached news cafe was inexpensive with very friendly staff. Their internet access was poor as the two computers did not work during my stay. The location was good being only steps from the Trevi Fountain. It was a short walk to bus and subway stations and only minutes to shopping and cafes. All of the tourist sites are within reasonable walks of the hotel or can be reached within two stops on the subway. All in all this is a good hotel and a reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Italian Gem”
Reviews.Author: mountainview03
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel near everything in the heart of Rome. We had a room that had just been renovated. The room and bathroom was small but adequate--marble from floor to ceiling in the bath. It was clean and the staff was friendly. Buffet style breakfast consisted of breads, salami, bacon, cheeses and cold cereals. We would definitely stay here again.
