Reviews.Title: “Avoid til September”
Reviews.Author: Marcus36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Accademia for two nights in June 2007, having previously stayed at the hotel on two earlier occasions. The reason we have chosen this hotel in the past has been location, and the friendly courteous staff. Having booked for this trip and paid more than I have ever before I was horrified to arrive at the hotel and find the frontage completed covered in scaffolding and dust sheeting. On checking into the room I found an extremely dusty window which did not lock, and scaffolding outside, making the room vulnerable to intruders. To give them credit, the hotel staff moved us to another room in the hotel which was much, much better, and so the problem was solved. My only remaining concern is when I specifically asked the question 'What time do the workmen begin?' I was told 'around 8.30' by reception. Had he said '7.00 o clock' I might well have moved hotels, but that was the time that drills, electric saws, and hammers began each day. Once the renovation is complete (August) this hotel should return to the establishment that we have loved in the past. Until then, please heed my warning; don't expect to lie in, and don't expect to be able to open your window without fear of a workman walking past, even on the fourth floor! Reception staff, but for this one gaffe, are excellent, and, as an earlier reviewer has already said, please remember that this is a European hotel, and comparisions with what you might expect in America are a little silly. If you don't like small rooms, stay on your side of the pond.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JB1976
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Rome at the Accademia hotel, and these are my observations: BEDROOM: I rather say ROOM for a BED, it was very very small, but still had a mini fridge, tv and a desk & chair; mattress was confy enough to sleep, maybe helped by long lasting “passeggiata” (walks) through Rome. Heating worked properly. BATHROOM: It was recently renewed, and it was extra-clean (it really matters for me!); shower worked perfectly and there was no mold inside (I showed barefeet) ELEVATOR: Oldy and small, still works BREAKFAST: Decent; corn flakes, croissants, nutella, scrambled eggs, some italian ham, fruits. Service was OK. DESK: Decent, english spoken. LOCATION: TERRIFIC! It’s the main reason to stay in here, just within a rock’s trow to Trevi fountain NOISE: A little bit, hotel is under reconstruction, because of its perfect location disadvantages, there’s always noisy /drunky people outside. RESTAURANT: No clue! CONCLUSION: Be aware that YOU ARE NOT in America, an European 3 star hotel could be 2 star (or even less) hotel for american standars; and prices are so high (I paid 950$ for 3 nights). I suggest to think of it just like nightsleeping accomodation and you will spend a nice stay. Its location is so worthy!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Curgal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Accademia for 6 nights first week of April (Easter week) in 2007. I had orginally wanted another hotel but it was not available so I selected this one based on the trip advisor reviews. We arrived early around 11am and we were afraid we would have to wait until the 2pm check in time but we got a room right away. We asked for a nonsmoking room (as per their website) but the desk attendant said all rooms are smoking but they clean them every day. Well we were given a room in the Superior Wing, which I think is a new part of the hotel. GREAT room, clean and most important quiet! Only drawbacks were it could us more lighting, as it was rather dim, and then the major drawback - the beds were hard as ROCKS and took some getting used to. Really uncomfortable the first few nights, but once you get used to them and because you are so tired, you do eventually fall asleep. Another perk to the hotel is that they have internet access that only costs 5 euros and you can use it as much as you like during your stay. This is great as when in Paris, it was like, 5 euros everytime you used it and we shelled out around 20 euros alone for this. So that was great as it made it easy to keep in touch with home. The hotel is located near the Trevi Fountain and yes, it gets very crowded around that area, but it is not right outside the hotel so you do not get a lot of noise from it. Probably rooms on the other side may get street noise. We used ear plugs at night so that the sound of people's voices or flushing toilets did not bother us that much. Ear plugs in any hotel is a must. Plus, once you get your bearings, there is no need to walk through the Trevi crowds to get to the hotel as you can come from the opposite direction as well and avoid all that, which we did all the time. Other times we did walk through but no one bothered us, and if they did try to sell something we just gave a firm no and kept walking and were left alone. Also the hotel is in a great location for walking. We walked to everything with the expection of the Vatican (took the 62 bus up the street) and when we went to Ostia Antica (closer version of Pompeii but less crowded, a bit smaller but still huge, and only 40 minutes away from center Rome) for that we took two subways and then a train. Otherwise Pantheon, Forum, Villa Borghese Park, Colosseum, many piazza, Traveste area etc. all within walking distance (though you can take subways and buses if you want). Plus the hotel location enabled us to go out in the morning, come back for a nap, and then go out for the later afternoon/evening activities so we were well rested the entire vacation and out feet didn't hurt as much from all the walking. I should mention there is construction going on at the hotel, but we only heard it in the morning and we were up so it did not matter. Also, the breakfast was plentiful and good - pastries, eggs, bacon, little sausage things, yogurt that my sister loved, granola and other cereals, breads, coffee, tea, fruit. Way more choices and heartier than the breakfasts we had in London or Paris. Saves money too. All in all, I'd come back here if I ever returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: vanessaws
Reviews.Content: Disgusting! That’s the only way I can describe Accademia hotel. The hotel is badly maintained, dirty, noisy. I was supposed to stay there for 4 nights during my honeymoon, but could not stand for more than one night (and I actually couldn’t sleep at all). What they claim to be an advantage, close to Fontana de Trevi, is actually a huge problem because you can hear the young crowd all night long. Breakfast there is another sad story: even with nice attendants, you have to fight to get a piece of bread! My advice: do not even consider Accademia. I am sure you can get decent hotels for much, much less!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: teamginger
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel after reading the many positive reviews.location is very central about 50mts from the trevi fountain.all the major sites are easily reached by foot,we made it to the vatican,spanish steps and the colesium to name a few between 20-30 mins maximum.the vatican,st peters and cistien chapel were the best but try to check opening hours as some days they close early,most sundays closed all day.we visited on a thursday and experienced 30 min queue in the morning,no queue at lunchtime.our room on the third floor was good.tv with bbc world service to keep up with the news.mini bar had plenty of space to store your own drinks.the reception staff were very friendly and the breakfast consisted of cold continental plus hot bacon,scrambled eggs,small sausages and a very slow toaster,plenty to start the day off.there are plenty of places to eat in the sidestreets around the hotel.i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wendyann67
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Accademia Hotel, 12-16th March 2007. The hotel is located within a few steps of the trevi fountain and is close to Barberini Metro. The hotel room that my husband and I stayed in was fairly small but was adequate and comfortable for a 4 night break. The maid kept it spotlessly clean and in keeping with city centre hotels it compared favourably to others that we have stayed in. The buffet breakfast was a godsend, there was plenty of it and it was good. Rome is expensive for eating out and you need to have your wits about you, but the breakfast filled us up and therefore we only snacked at Lunchtime. There was internet access in the hotel lobby which was convenient and reasonably cheap, and a quick phoncall to England from our hotel room was surprisingly cheap. We loved Rome and I would certainly have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: walinne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Accademia for six nights. Location is excellent, you can walk to all the interesting sites from the hotel. But, although it is winter time, Rome is very very crowded ( two hours and a half for the queue at the Vatican museums, one hour for the coupole of St Peter, one hour at the Colosseo..)and very noisy. Tot get back to the hotel, we had to cross the crowd ot the Trevi Fountain and it felt like the metro at six PM ! Many many gadgets sellers who bother you every meter too. Otherwise, Rome is a beautiful city. The hotel was nice, clean, room quite small ( twin standard, some standards seemed larger) and bathroom very small but breakfast is very good. The people in Rome are not very nice, mostly on the touristic sites where they can be even very rude although I spoke italian. At the hotel, the woman receptionist in the evening was very nice and it was good to get a smile !

Reviews.Title: “what a find”
Reviews.Author: happy_to_be_on_hol
Reviews.Content: have just returned from a three night stay at the hotel, very friendly and helpful staff (cases taken up to room for us). we had requested non smoking, as there are none, we were put in one of the newer rooms which turned out to be one of the superior rooms. very clean and room service second to none bedding changed and we were only there for the three nights, breakfast had more than enough choices for even the most fussy of people. hotel situated in one of the best locations for the attractions (just around the corner from the Trevi Fountain). many places to eat including the little restaurant next to the hotel. be careful crossing the roads transport does not stop even when lights are on red. do not forget to take the camera with you there are many pictures to be taken and treasured. you could walk to all of the main attractions and many not so main. plenty of good shops. we even spotted an english actor at the trevi fountain. you cannot believe how wonderful this city is and how amazing the attractions are having only seen them on the television until you see them for yourself, my husband was in awe of the vatican and collosium. recommend the hotel highly and the City even more. Linda and David Campbell South Shields

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: Koit
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Accademia for 3 nights at the end of November and two be honest I was a bit sceptical after seeing some of the pictures on the net... Now I can admit I was wrong! Location is obviously excellent an the room we got was perfect - much more I would expect from a 3 star establishment. Nice plasma TV with a large number of channels, sound system in the room, very decent bathroom, good breakfast and a VERY friendly and helpful stuff. The only thing I missed was a decent internet connection - as I stayed on the first floor I got some weak WIFI signal from the lobby, otherwise this is the only place you can connect. There is also an internet connected PC you can use in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: vlopresto
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. It's right near the Trevi Fountain and very central. We booked a superior room and the room was very nicely appointed, wood beamed ceilings, built ins, good aircon, large modern bath with double sinks. The beds were the temperpedic type - foam and felt hard at first but gave no back pain at all - due to no springs - we think. The breakfast was good, hot and plentiful. The hotel also has seperate lounge areas on each floor and some extra livingroom areas with large screen TV and a library. Very nice. There was an outdoor terrace area on our floor. Only drawback is we had to exit the hotel from a seperate entrance to find the breakfast area as the main part of the hotel in in the adjoining building. There is an inside connection somewhere but it's very hard to find. But that was no problem. The staff were curteous. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: sashleah
Reviews.Content: After being transferred from the Hotel White due to them overbooking, we were transferred to Accademia and given a superior room. The superior rooms are quite small and had two single beds, a mini bar, desk, TV and safe in a cupboard. The bathroom was fine with a shower cubicle with a superb power shower. I think the rooms are quite small in this area of Rome but you are only needing them to sleep and shower. There was air conditioning which was needed at this time of year. The breakfasts were good and available from 7.00 to 10.30 and had a good selection of hot food, cereal, yoghurt, pastries, rolls, cheese and ham, etc. It was good and set you up for a day of sight seeing. The hotel is in an excellent location for seeing Rome. The trevi fountain is less than a minute walk from the hotel, Within 10 minutes walking you can be at the Spanish Steps, The Pantheon, Piazza Navona and other beautiful sights in between. You also get a voucher for a 'buy one get one free' drink at the bar attached to the hotel which was great for sport and a drink when you returned back to the hotel. There are great restaurants and bars around the hotel and little streets that open up into another fountain, great building etc. There is a bus tour that stops at the top of the street and it cost 13 Euro's for a ticket that lasts 24 hours. The tour was excellent and you can get on and off when you want. This is the way we went to see the Colliseum and the Vatican on the second day. You can walk everywhere and the Vatican took about 30 minutes but the tour was great to get your bearings. I would definately stay at the hotel when I return to Rome for the location. The Trevi Fountain was always busy but we went down at 5 a.m on the last day (we were getting picked up for the airport at 5.35) and it was amazing as we were the only people there. After this break I was more that happy to throw my three coins, over my shoulder, into the fountain to ensure I return to Rome shortly.

Reviews.Title: “SOURface receptioist”
Reviews.Author: ddjjmm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Accademia for two nights and found it good for location....trevi fountain.Some nice restaurants near by.Try Thats Amore a charming little place two minutes walk.But on the downside a gloomy receptionist who couldnt be bothered replying to my "ciao" the first time i entere. Smiley aside the room was very small, with a shower that overflowed to all parts of the bathroom.That was a health hazard inspection waiting to happen.They say you pay for what you get...wellpay a bit extra and get a whole lot more elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: tailo
Reviews.Content: Me& my wife spent 4 nights in Rome and stayed in Hotel Accademia,the room wasn't big but O.K for two of us,it was situated on the 2nd floor overlooking the back street,very quite all through the days,except you could hear flushing toilet next door,air con was poor,the bathroom above average. Breakfast served in buffet style,you get the same menu everyday,would recommend the hotel to change one or two items every couple of days. Due to its cental location,you could almost walk to most of the major attractions,but if want to travel by bus,make sure you buy the ticket before boarding. We found people in Rome are not very friendly,but in Hotel Accademia,the staffs were acceptable.Score out of 10 , I will give 6.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: mama_zoeloe
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome to celebrate our fifth weddinganniversary, it was a surprise from me to my husband. I didn't expext much, I took a hotel in the centre, cheaper than the other hotels in the centre and with an american breakfast (said the brochure) to avoid the search for a breakfast in the city (I wanted to spend my time on sightseeing offcourse). Everything was positive: - room was ok, not to little and not big, wall a little dirty, but you are only there to sleep, so what. Bathroom ok, more than enough soap (good!) shower gel to wash yourself, hairdryer, no bath, shower. Only negative point is that the curtein of the shower was to small, so after a shower, the bathroom was a swimming pool. But towels enough to put on the floor ans you get new every day. - Good airconditioning that we could let on during the night (not much noise). - room at the back of the hotel -> we didn't hear a thing of celebrating Italians after winning the quart finales of the WK! We slept very well, bed was fine too. - breakfast was perfect, scrambled eggs, saucages, bacon, hard boiled eggs, toaster, bread, jam, honey, choco, fruit, yoghurt, coffee, milk, fruit juice.... we ate so we bearly had to eat at lunch. - Location couldn't be better, couple of steps away from the trevi fontain and other important places (parthenon f.e.), there is a busstop and metro nearby. We didn't use transfert to the airport, you can take the metro and the train for 6 euros. There are plenty of good and not to pricy restaurants nearby. Perfect hotel if you do a citytrip and you only need the hotel to sleep and have a good braekfast. Otherwise ther is nothing in the hotel (bar, lounge). We would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “OK but expensive”
Reviews.Author: AndyBernadette
Reviews.Content: I read somewhere that you can hear the sound of the Trevi fountain from the Acccademia. I am not sure about that but for 2 nights we had to endure the sound of a faulty toilet cistern in our room, and a toilet that would not flush. To be fair, the hotel did offer us a move to an alternative room, albeit of a lesser standard, and in the end they did waive the superior room supplement. On a positive note, Accademia is in a splendid location if you want to be central, and within walking distance of most of the major attractions. There are numerous bars and restraunts within walking distance of the hotel and we didn't need to resort to public transport at any time. The hotel provided a taxi to take us back to the airport for 40 euros which was considerably cheaper than the fare from the airport to the hotel. The room we had was classed as superior because it had recently been refurbished and apart from the problem with the plumbing, it was a nice room. The bedroom was well decorated in a contemporary style and the bathroom was spacious and modern. The bedroom was however small given it's superior rating, and I suspect this may be the norm in Rome unless you pay an exceptional price. Breakfast was continental and very good. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DoreenTennant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Accademia Hotel for 3 nights in May 2006. It is a "coins throw" from the Trevi Fountain and central enought to be able to walk to all other attractions in Rome, even the Vatican, and there are numerous bars and restaurants on your doorstep. We had a room on the 3rd floor which looked as if it had been recently renovated, and the bathroom was spacious and well laid out. The breakfast was a good selection of cereals, cheese and meats, croissants and toast and plenty of it. The staff were most helpful and pleasant too. All in all we could not fault this hotel and it's location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eric_Ambleside
Reviews.Content: The Accademia is a matter of yards from the Trevi Fountain, though mercifully you don't get any of the noise from the approximately three million people that pack into the tiny Piazza at all times of day. The hotel is easy walking distance from the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps et al. It's a great location without a doubt, which compensates for the relatively high price. We stayed in a superior room, which I think has a higher standard of decor. Very clean, everything worked (as far as everything ever does in an Italian city!), and was quiet, being situated at the rear of the hotel. No pretty view, but peace and quiet is preferable after a hard day walking the frantic streets of Rome. Only downer was the startlingly noisy plumbing from the room above, which might be a concern to the light sleeper. Room 353 - bear that in mind. We encountered very pleasant and helpful reception staff. Breakfast: I can't let a previous review go without comment. Of course they don't do breakfast for the British - the hotel is in Rome, and it's run by Italians. If they did "British" breakfast, they'd have to do American, Japanese, French, German and no doubt Martian breakfast as well. In reality, breakfast was just fine, with the usual range of continental choices at reasonable quality. Note: the hotel does a private car hire deal to the Rome airports for only 40 Euros. This is considerably cheaper, quicker and easier than using the Leonardo Express (9.50 per person) from Fiumicino plus a cab from the Termini (lots of Euros!). Highly recommended. Overall, a good standard for a Rome city hotel, albeit not cheap, but the location definitely makes it worth it. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeMWood
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel within walking distance of all major sights which was a real bonus. This was booked to celebrate my 40th birthday and whether it was fault of travel operator or hotel, I don't know. Room very small, supposedly refurbished room but very drab and colourless. Bathroom very nice however. No bath. Very noisy, over the bar below. Self service breakfast was a joke, catered for 'Europeans' rather than British. No variety. Straggly bacon, cocktail sausages and scrambled egg only things hot. Tired cornflakes and hard bread. Toaster on last legs. If both of you got up from the table, waiter cleared it and reset it again, so make sure one always at table! For a country that loves its food, very bad. Disappointed no bar, no lounge. We were expecting more from what we read in brochure. Obviously as a hotel in centre of Rome it couldn't be that big and have a lot of facilities, but the quality of what was there was poor. No mention made of my birthday which travel operator supposedly told hotel of, even when WE mentioned it we didn't get an upgrade to bigger room. Would not stay there again as not what we were expecting. But if you can put up with all this, the location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Disabled facilities”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Accademia Hotel from 22-25 March 2006. In general we found the staff to be very helpful and polite, the location was excellent and the breakfasts were good, but our room had an awful smell of damp carpet and we were given an air freshner for carpets to spray every time we entered the room! However the main reason for this review is to advise others of the disabled facilities in the hotel (which we found hard to come by when we were looking for a hotel). We were advised when we booked that the hotel had a disabled room & adapted bathroom and was fully accessable in a wheelchair. After check in we were shown to a seperate entrance to get to the Superior wing (there is only one disabled room & this is in the superior wing). This involves swiping through a door, then one small step into the hall then one larger step (which would require assistance) to get to the lift. Alternatively there was a fire exit door which could be opened to avoid these steps. The bedroom was a reasonable size but we found that the bathroom, although large enough to accomodate a wheelchair, did not have any grab rails or even a seat in the shower. We were given a plastic garden chair to put in the shower when we complained about this. To get to the breakfast room we had to go back down in the lift, out of our seperate entrance, walk outside the hotel and into reception then up a small ramp to the breakfast room. This is because the lift that goes direct to reception is up four steps from the disabled bedroom. Overall it was manageable but not the best hotel for someone in a wheelchair, and we felt that the room should not be advertised as a disabled room. Other tips for wheelchair users in Rome - The buses are accessable but the ramps do not always work when you try to get off! The Vatican Museum, St Peters Basilica, the Pantheon & Colosseum are all accessable. Its hard work in Rome on the cobbles, but its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm absolutely thrilled with the Accademia Hotel. As many reviews have stated, this hotel was in THE PERFECT location! The Trevi Fountain is right around the corner. We easily walked to The Pantheon, Spanish Steps and even the Vatican. This hotel is bit of a way from Termini Station and I recommend you take a taxi or car directly to the hotel from the airport. My husband and I decided to take the local Metro and pickpockets abound in Termini Station and other Metro lines. We almost fell victim. With your suitcases and backpacks, you're too easily a target and they can distract you easier. Take the taxi or car. That's our one regret. The hotel staff is very friendly and they had a stash of umbrellas for use in the lobby which was an extra nice touch that we took advantage of one morning. The hotel breakfast was the best hotel breakfast we had during our trip through Italy. We had a Queen bed and the room was nice. It faced the back of the hotel so we didn't have a great view, but it was quieter. The room was a little small, but expected. Very nice bathroom. Included a hair dryer. Would recommend you bring your own washcloth, if needed as none of the hotels we stayed in Italy provided them. We got CNN in English on TV, which was nice. Didn't get an english station in other hotels we stayed in. I would definitely stay here again if I went back to Rome which hopefully I will one day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: YS_IL
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a long weekend in Rome. The hotel location is super. We could walk from the hotel to any location. A taxi cost us 10Euro to the Vatican and we walked back to the hotel through the Piazza Navova. The hotel breakfast is very good. We came to the hotel very early in the morning but still one room was already prepared for us. We noticed that each room has different size. Wireless internet was available in the room so we could use Skype very easily. The hotel reception staff helped us very kindly for booking a train to Florence (spoke ~15 min over the phone).

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HollyFLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: The other reviews are correct. The location of this hotel is amazing, tucked right behind the Trevi Fountain. All sights are in walking distance. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was ample and delicious. Fair enough, the room was small but it had all that was needed, in a city like Rome you don't spend much time in the room. Bathroom and bedroom clean. Excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Position”
Reviews.Author: mikey47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Accadamia for 2 nights at New Year after reading reviews here. It is ideally located for all the main sights with the Colosseum to the south, Vatican to the west and Spanish Steps to the north, all within 20 minutes walk. Trevi fountain is 50 yards away! We decided to upgrade to a room in the Superior wing after reading reviews and the room was still quite small but well appointed. It looked out onto an internal courtyard so there was no road noise. The soundproofing between rooms was very poor though. There is no restaurant or bar but breakfast, included in the rate, is available in a room off from reception. I have no qualms in recommending this hotel to others for it's accessibility.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: GRtravelMiami_FL
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, walking distance to many important must see places, friendly staff, good breakfast, the quadruple room has good space for European standards, good value

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and functional”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location within walking distance of virtually all major tourist attractions. The Vatican will take about 30 mins walk but the rest are closer, particularly the Trevi Fountain, which is just round the corner. The staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfasts were good. The room was small but then I supopse it is the city centre. There was some building work going on on the 4th floor when we were there but then we were always going to have early starts anyway. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was ok but I would just mention a lack of plugs for chargers/hair dryers etc as the tv and fridge had to be unplugged first. There are plenty of places to eat and drink in the locality. The News Cafe just round the corner is good for a drink or two and there is an English theme pub 'The Albert' on Via Traforo for a taste of home. Food wise we found the best place to eat was Il Chianti, turn left from the hotel and 100 yds away on the Via Lavatore. Don't be put off by the name of the street the food was outstanding and good value too. Just a note for those interested in watching English football while abroad. There was an Irish? bar (can't remember the name) on the Via d. Botteghe Oscure near the Vittoria Monument showing Premier League games live.

Reviews.Title: “Good, convienent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawnymarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Accademia in Rome just this past Thanksgiving. The hotel, was by no means ritzy, but provided a clean, friendly place to rest one's head at night. There was a decent hot breakfast offered everyday and the staff was kind and helpful. My only complaint was that the concierge did not provide us with our wake-up call the day we were leaving (he must have dialed the wrong room) but it all worked out in the end. One of the best things I think, was that it was so close to the Trevi Fountain that one was able to go there and appreciate it at times when the din of the tourist crowds had subsided. Also, it's in walking distance to The Pantheon, good resturants, other attractions, and a subway stop(Barberini).

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: cdimse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Accademia for three nights in the middle of September prior to taking a twelve day Med Cruise. We chose the hotel based on the excellent reviews on Venere. We found the location to be outstanding, the desk staff to be very friendly and mostly helpful. Our room had twin beds, and was very tiny even by European standards. We paid 228 euroes a night and were told we had been upgraded to a deluxe room. I shudder to think of the size of a regular room as two people could not pass each other comfortably anywhere in the room. On the other hand, our bathroom was very spacious, almost as large as the room, and appeared to be recently renovated. It was immaculately clean. The weather was very warm when we arrived , and when I inquired about the air conditioning, we were told it wasn't working. In reply to my question of when it would be fixed, we received that wonderful Italian shrug of the shoulders, and were told, "maybe two hours, maybe two days". Later that evening I requested a fan since it was extremely uncomfortable, and one was brought up very quickly. The air conditioning never did really work well during our entire stay. Breakfasts were excellent, however, the staff in the breakfast room was very unfriendly and not the least bit helpful. There is a very nice trattoria right outside the hotel, and itis an easy walk to just about all the major sights. I think the price was too hight for value received and would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Past holidays in central Rome were often marred by sleepless nights thanks to zooming scooters and screaming sirens. Not so at the Accademia, which offers perfect peace and quiet not 50 metres from the Trevi. Our room was bigger than we expected, with a separate area for a desk/dressing table. Fittings, including bathroom, were stylish and spotlessly clean. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfasts were great. The Accademia is a wonderful little hotel. We recommend it highly, and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Travellingjanny
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night trip to Rome staying at the Accademia Hotel. The location was fantastic, being only 100 yards from the Trevi Fountain, so was very central for all the main areas of interest and most within walking distance. On arrival at the hotel we checked in and were shown to our room, which we had already paid for back in the UK via a web site. We paid 800 USD for 4 nights, which on reflection was a lot of money for the standard of hotel. Our room was on the 1st floor at the back of the building, so it was quiet and away from the main street noise but we had no view whatsoever. The room was small with twin beds, a TV (which stated was cable but there were no English speaking channels on it at all), a safe and air conditioning. We had our own bathroom with bath and shower, WC and bidet. The bathroom was fine and very clean. The air conditioning was very inadequate, having no controls on it for you to monitor the unit and as this was directly underneath the window, the curtains were floor length and draped in front of the air conditioning unit so this proved no use at all. The room got very hot, quite unbearably so at night which made sleeping difficult and the noise from the unit outside our bedroom window was very noisy so you couldn't really have the window open either. Overall our stay at this hotel was OK, we couldn't fault the place for cleanliness and location but our main points of complaint would have to be the air conditioning in our bedroom, the extremely miserable staff (one lady in particular) in the breakfast room and the beds were like rock. I suffered from backache because of this even for a few days after our return home. However, after saying all this, I would recommend the hotel to others, if only mainly for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Good Room. Would come back”
Reviews.Author: Neon
Reviews.Content: I will say first off the reviewer from the Midlands has reviewed the wrong hotel (she mentions Pisa). The Hotel Accademia is well located (not in an industrial estate). I've given the hotel an average rating since there wasn't anything particulary special about it. I would go back again as it's what I was after. Location - fantastic (we were about 100 yards from the Trevi Fountain and about a 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps in the other direction. We were off the main road which meant we didn't have any noise and cars didn't seem to drive past the hotel unless they were doing a drop off. The hotel is over a 'news cafe' which is basically a bar in the evening. Although I'm not sure it's a problem past midnight (at least not from our experience). Room - we were given a free upgrade from a standard room (paid through expedia) to the superior wing (room 353). We had booked a double but got given a twin bed and the in room safe door didn't shut. We could have argued this out but didn't feel it was worth it and locked our valuables in a bag every day. The room wasn't particulary big and the bathroom was very small (struggle to fit two people in at the same time) but who's spending all their time in their room? Toiletries are provided (LUX combined shower & shampoo fixed on wall of shower cubicle) cleanser, body lotion, cotton buds, shoe shine, shower cap and soap. These were not replaced when used. Minibar was kept in a small cupboard and as a result didn't keep anything particulary chilled. The maid doesn't make a note of what's drunk everyday and so you tell reception when you check out. No tea or coffee facilties so bring your own kettle, adapter and tea bags. Milk can be purchased for .80 euros at a supermarket (we bought ours from L'Antico Forno at Piazza Trevi) and kept it in the mini bar. For your reference, red carton - skimmed, green is semi-skimmed and blue is whole. Service was good. The maid forgot our bath towels one day and within 5 minutes of calling reception we had some brought up. The terrace was next to our room (we also saw one next to the 4th floor superior rooms). We seemed to have it to ourselves which was nice. Breakfast was fine. Scrambled eggs and bacon (didn't try so can't comment), pastries, muffins, toast, boiled eggs, meats, cheese, juice, tea, coffee. Self service. HOTEL TIPS I've read the 1st floor isn't the best and to request the 4th floor when booking. The hotel has three seperate lifts which made us think it was different buildings made into one hotel. The 4th floor superior wing is on the safe floor as rooms 309-312. I guess the rooms are just nicer. Hotel White (4 star) & Hotel Tritone (2 star) are in the same chain. Hotel Tritone had road works immediately outside and the hotel was on a main road

HotelInfo.Name: Accademia Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Roma Pizza Accademia Di San Luca 74, 00187 Rome, Italy
